With Sign-In With Ethereum, the @spruceid team is already creating a standard that would enable users to access public and private resources from their wallet. They‚Äôre just getting started, join their journey.

I‚Äôve known co-founders @wycdd & @obstropolos for years - these resilient, clear-eyed thinkers have an exceptional technical understanding of the ethereal concept of decentralized identity. We‚Äôre also excited about the seedlings of possibility that will proliferate around Spruce.

The SpruceID toolkit enables web3.0 native functionality for signing to access off-chain resources and to verify trusted data/credentials. Kepler enables 
users to store and share their data directly from their wallets - behold the new S3 for self-sovereign data.

As we spend more time online, the promise of web3.0 needs to address the failings of web2 walled garden, and create resilient, flexible, and open identity 
facets that are user-controlled.

We‚Äôre seeing our digital lives trump our physical worlds in importance ‚Äì we own and flex NFT's, make OS/grants contributions on @gitcoin and find our 
tribes through DAO‚Äôs.

A core component of the Web3.0 stack is user-centric identity & the ability to link credentials and trusted data artefacts together in a permissionless manner. @SpruceID is building the foundational layer for this and @etherealvc is excited to be co-leading their seed round. https://t.co/KAAwoPsipC
